content.question: Which of the following is the best procedure to use to determine if the lightbulbs are ohmic or nonohmic?

choices.label: Use one potential difference setting on the power source and take one set of measurements for each lightbulb.
Use two potential difference settings on the power source and take a set of measurements for one lightbulb.
Use one lightbulb and take measurements for a number of different potential difference settings on the power source.
Use each lightbulb and take measurements for the same two different potential difference settings on the power source.

content.answer: Use one lightbulb and take measurements for a number of different potential difference settings on the power source.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
